page.title: 05SCHOOL IN CHADDESLEY CORBETT
page.content: Chaddesley Corbett Endowed First School has a long history. According to records there was a school in the village in 1500. In 1632 a Commission of Charitable uses found that property in the area "had been long thereto given for the maintenance of a free school". The trust funds are now administered by the Chaddesley Corbett Educational Foundation and the school is designated a Voluntary Aided School Children are admitted when they are rising five and normally transfer to Sladen C.of E.Middle School Kidderminster at the beginning of the Autumn term following their 9th birthday. There are approx. 40 children on roll and on average 10 children are admitted each year. In Jubilee Year the Trustees sponsored a playgroup the children joining when they are rising four.
